result.execSummary:
All charges against Kodi C. Olson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kodi C. Olson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kodi C. Olson

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation. Filed by Atty Renc.

Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Kodi C. Olson.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are: 21CF334, 21CF-407, 21CF-444, 21CM-304, 22CF-16, 22CF-96, 22CF-97, 21TR-2768, and 21TR-2769. 

3:08 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea hearing today.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Plea offer sheet has been handed out.
21CF-334: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3. Count 2 and Count 4 and Count 5 will be dismissed and read in.
21CF-407: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4 will be dismissed and read in.
21CM-304: Case is dismissed and read in.
21CF-444: Case is dismissed and read in.
22CF-16: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
22CF-96: Case is dismissed and read in.
22CF-97: State moves to dismiss this case outright.
21TR-2768 and 2769: State moves to dismiss cases.

Court questions Atty Dodge regarding the basis for the outright dismissal of 22CF-97.
Parties will be requesting a presentence investigation.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF-334: Count 1: No Contest.
21CF-334: Count 3: No Contest.
21CF-407: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-16: Count 1:No Contest. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of  21CF-334: Count 1 and Count 3, 21CF-407: Count 2 and 22CF-16: Count 1. 
Domestic abuse charges are clarified. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
21CF-334: Count 2 and Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-407: Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4: Dismissed and read in.
21CM-304: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-444: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-16: Count 2: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-96: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-97: Dismissed outright.
21TR-2768: Dismissed.
21TR-2769: Dismissed.

State has complied with victim rights.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a presentence investigation be produced. 
Presentence be done and filed no later than close of business on August 19th.
If either party has alternative sentencing documents or supporting letters, to be filed by August 26th.
Bond is continued. 

3:40 PM Matters are concluded.
Plea hearing on June 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Matter set for a Plea Hearing on 06/28/2022 at 3:00 p.m.
Matter set for a PTC on 05/31/2022 at 11:00 a.m.  - One last pre-trial before parties decide to set for argued plea/sent hearing or a jury trial
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

An amended information will need to be filed to correct the ofense date.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:24 PM . Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Kodi C. Olson.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.   ADA Dodge calls witness Officer Ashley Hansen who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Cross exam by Atty Renc. No further witnesses and no arguments.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kodi C. Olson
Current: 3211 Ryans Way, Wisconsin Rapid, WI 54494   (Effective: 02-21-2022)
Prior: 1250 1St St N, Wisconsin Rapid, WI 54494
sent to DOC Interface on 06/29/22 sp

No contact with K.R.O. or her residence
Comply with all open bond conditions.

2:02 PM Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Kodi C. Olson.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Renc.
